head.supplied: Melbourne, 17th April 1891 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to your enquiry regarding the duties of George French, temporarily employed in the Govt. Botanist's Branch, I have the honor to inform you, that he is pa...

div.p: R91/3938, unit 611, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 17th April 1891

In reply to your enquiry regarding the duties of George French, temporarily employed in the Govt. Botanist's Branch, I have the honor to inform you, that he is partly engaged in making up collections of seeds for correspondents, partly in laying out newly arrived botanical specimens, in which work he has acquired considerable experience and thus saves a great deal of time to the permanent officers. Otherwise he is employed in going errands, keeping office-rooms in order etc.
See also M to G. Langridge, 24 March 1891; M to H. Moors, 9 July 1891.
